page.title: 13BOTLEY FARM MUSEUM
page.content: Work on the Botley Farm Museum started in 1975.It was set up to show what farming was like in Hampshire between 1850 and 1950.The people who work there are a curator,a farm manager,a stockman and a tractor driver.There are also 3 security men,3 attendants, a receptionist and 7 part-time cashiers and attendants.The animals on the farm include Wessex saddleback pigs, Shorthorns and Guernsey cows, North Downs and Dorset horn sheep.Some of the buildings were brought from other parts of Hampshire and special craftsmen were found to rebuild them. The museum has been open for 1 year and the public have been charged since April.80,370 people have visited the museum.
